Media.MediaTitle: esophageal squamous cell carcinoma stage IIB (1)

ImageData.LabelName: Stage IIB Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Esophagus (1)

OriginalSource.Creator: Terese Winslow
OriginalSource.Comment: Image revisions made per AJCC 8th edition staging

Changed brackets to curly brackets with the label line pointing to the middle of the bracket; added label for Submucosa, pointing to the white band near the top, and made the mucosa layer just include the layers from the top of the submucosa to the top of the image; and made the connective tissue layer at the very bottom a little thicker
Moved the label "OR" down so that it lines up with the mucosa layer; changed label on body figure to “Upper and middle esophagus”.

Removed the labels "Part 1 OR Part 2"; widened the white strip in between the two parts of the inset by separating them out and put the word “OR” in between; and put a bracket around the top 2/3 of the esophagus and changed the label to “Upper to mid esophagus"

Made the label "Cancer" point to both sides of the inset; on the left side of the inset, extended the cancer down into the connective tissue layer; and on the right side of the inset, decreased the amount of cancer so that it only extends into the top band of the muscle layers
Faded the lymph nodes; took off the label Submucosa and made the Mucosa label bracket that layer along with the top layer

ContentDescriptions.ContentDescription: Stage IIB squamous cell cancer of the esophagus (1); drawing shows the upper and middle parts of the esophagus and the stomach. An inset shows grade 2 or 3 cancer cells in the mucosa layer, thin muscle layer, submucosa layer, thick muscle layer, and connective tissue layer of the upper and middle esophagus wall.

Stage IIB squamous cell cancer of the esophagus (1); drawing shows the upper and middle parts of the esophagus and the stomach. An inset shows grade 2 or 3 cancer cells in the mucosa layer, thin muscle layer, submucosa layer, thick muscle layer, and connective tissue layer of the upper and middle esophagus wall.

Captions.MediaCaption: Stage IIB squamous cell cancer of the esophagus (1). Cancer has spread into the connective tissue layer of the esophagus wall. The cancer cells are grade 2 or 3. Grade 2 and 3 cancer cells look more abnormal under a microscope and grow and spread more quickly than grade 1 cancer cells. The tumor is in either the upper or middle esophagus.

Stage IIB squamous cell cancer of the esophagus (1). Cancer has spread into the connective tissue layer of the esophagus wall. The cancer cells are grade 2 or 3. Grade 2 and 3 cancer cells look more abnormal under a microscope and grow and spread more quickly than grade 1 cancer cells. The tumor is in either the upper or middle esophagus.

ProposedUse.Glossary: stage II esophageal squamous cell carcinoma

ProcessingStatus.ProcessingStatusValue: Approved by expert reviewer with changes
ProcessingStatus.Comment: Image and caption need modifications per J. Faris
